author: potuz
content: This gets often neglected, but this is the actual issue. Running the tip of the chain at Gigagas/s along the lines of <@1009418255913472000>'s experiments is one thing. Trying to sync back when 33% fell off the grid for a couple of days is another. At the current gas limit we could not fix Holesky. At the limit of execution just forget it.

author: gcolvin
content:
> There is an EIP that describes network upgrade inclusion stages. 
> https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7723

I notice that at every point in that EIP it is the *client teams* who make decisions.  Nobody else.  In the present case:

> An EIP MAY be moved from Scheduled for Inclusion to Declined for Inclusion if *client teams* are against including the EIP in the network upgrade.

In my opinion the biggest problem was that the decision on whether to remove EOF was premature.  It should  have been made at the next ACDE call by consensus of the client teams.

author: timbeiko
content: We can debate the semantics of the SFI -> DFI removal clause, but I don't think it's fair to say that a weekly call attended by client teams where it was predetermined we'd make a decision is problematic. If you listen to the ACD where we scheduled this, we explicitly opted against doing it in 2 weeks to avoid potentially delaying EOF even more. I also posted in this discord + on EthMagicians that we'd be making the decision on the Monday call.

author: timbeiko
content:
and, sorry for the delay (got busy with Pectra stuff!), but assuming the upgrade goes smoothly tonight, I should have this published tomorrow! 

See you all on the livestream ðŸ«¡ !
